title: 1080TI i7-7700k 144hz Monitor-120FPS-but 90-100ms(ping)?
body:
I have a future proof PC gaming Monster, I need help to get ping to global average(about 20-34ms)

I see so many streamers,and people playing on less game intensive rigs than mine,but have better ping.

and we all know better ping means better play reactions


Located in WA
everything is real sluggish,and I get the short end of the stick because of it in team fights

when i should be pressing R  or flash, I get a huge delay like I did not press it all


please help resolve this ping issue.

replies.body:
Those "huge delays" you mentioned sound like it's most likely packet loss you're having problems with, which doesn't have anything to do with your rig. Run a traceroute to the NA server at 104.160.131.1 using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and post the results here so I can see. 

Packet loss happens outside of your network generally, but before it hits our servers, so it's likely being caused by certain nodes your ISP uses.

Global average is not 20-34 ms at all. I am very curious as to how you found that ping average. Many players play with 50-100 and in my experience that’s the most common ping players play with - but there’s players that make do with 100-200 ms ping as well. Ping is not influenced much by your graphics card and computer setup - your ping (latency) is an effect of solely your internet connection to Riot’s servers. If it’s below 100, there’s likely not *much* you can do to make it better other than moving closer to Chicago.

Your huge delay on key presses sounds like it may be packet loss of some kind and/or latency spikes. I recommend following [these steps from Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) - specifically for Packet Loss, Packet Buffering, and Disabling Peer-to-Peer Updates (Windows 10). If those don’t help, submit a support ticket so an agent can help look into it further for you.
